summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 between a DOJ OIG investigator and a Bureau of Prisons Communication Technician regarding an interview about camera system issues at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in August 2019. The technician provides details about hardware failures, repair work, and identifies other BOP/Signet personnel involved.

keyFacts: The DOJ OIG was investigating camera system failures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in August 2019, around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The camera system had critical failures due to bad hard drives and end-of-life equipment, with parts being unavailable.
A BOP electrician named Hughes was brought in from Butner on temporary duty to assist with the camera system installation.
The investigator specifically requested information on Jeffrey Colton's involvement with the camera issues.
The interview with the technician was voluntary and focused on obtaining documentation like work orders, purchase orders, and all related email communications.
